definition: to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The soldiers began to search the houses round about, and to pursue the fugitives .
sentences.chinese: 士兵們開始搜查四周的房屋並追捕逃亡者。

sentences.english: The fugitives could not have taken this as an encouraging sign.
sentences.chinese: 這些逃亡者並沒有被看作是鼓舞士氣的事件。

sentences.english: The fugitive is believed to be headed for the Canadian border.
sentences.chinese: 據信，逃亡者正向加拿大邊界方向逃竄。

sentences.english: The police scoured the country for the fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 公安機關在全國搜索逃亡者。

sentences.english: The fugitives travelled by night andrested by day .
Canada was the primary destination for many fugitives.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大是許多逃亡者的首選終點站。

sentences.english: Such escapees are relatively common wherever pet birds are kept.
sentences.chinese: 在養寵物鳥的地方，這種“逃亡者”比較常見。

sentences.english: The escapee's turnup is expected soon.
sentences.chinese: 預料很快就會出現逃亡者。

sentences.english: The escapee taped the grapes into this shape.
sentences.chinese: 逃亡者用紙帶將葡萄紮成這種形狀。

sentences.english: The soldiers began to search the houses round about, and to pursue the fugitives.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們開始搜查四周的房屋並追捕逃亡者。

sentences.english: The fugitives traveled by night and rested by day.
Only the defeated and deserters go to the wars, cowards that run away and enlist.
sentences.chinese: 只有被擊敗者和逃亡者開始作戰，懦夫逃跑獲得幫助。

sentences.english: The fugitives marry and return two months later to Wuthering Heights.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩個逃亡者結了婚，兩個月後回到了呼嘯山莊。

definition: horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
loose and disorganized soldiers/stragglers/fig. a loner
